item.title: New Marathon Story Trailer Leaks Final Release Date Early
item.content:encoded:
Tau Ceti IV is sick and the only cure is stylish PvEvP extraction gunplay. That’s the vibe of a new Marathon trailer that appears to have leaked on Xbox ahead of schedule. While Sony plays whack-a-mole to get the new footage taken down, screenshots from it showing a March 5, 2026 release date have already spread across the internet.

The new story trailer includes a fresh sizzle reel of previously unseen gameplay showing off the sci-fi multiplayer shooter’s various maps, runners, and guns. There’s a healthy dose of the Bungie project’s exceptional art peppered throughout. But of most interest to casual players will be the nod to an early March launch date.

Following its 2025 delay, the game only resurfaced with a vague March release window. This appears to confirm it’s coming at the early end of that range, giving Sony’s latest live-service game a few weeks to prove itself before the end of the fiscal year. According to Paul Tassi at Forbes, the new trailer and final release date are accurate, with Bungie planning the official announcement to go live this week.

There’s been some speculation among fans that Bungie will hold at least one round of open beta player tests before the game launches. If that’s the case, it now seems like a good bet we can expect those before the end of February. If so, it’ll be the last chance for people to go hands-on with the overhauled shooter for free before it arrives on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC behind a $40 price point.

Update: 1/29/2025, 11:04 a.m. ET: Bungie has gone ahead and released the official trailer and confirmed the game’s expansive voice cast:

Krizia Bajos, Samantha Béart, Beau Bridgland, Ry Chase, Roger Clark, Darin De Paul, Jennifer English, Dave Fennoy, Nika Futterman, Morla Gorrondona, Reina Guthrie, Donnla Hughes, Keston John, Sohm Kapila, Rich Keeble, Elliot Knight, Erica Lindbeck, Piotr Michael, Brent Mukai, Neil Newbon, Ariana Nicole George, Emily O’Brien, Lee Shorten, Jason Spisak, Ben Starr, JB Tadena, Fred Tatasciore, Craig Lee Thomas, Elias Toufexis, Oliver Vaquer, Scott Whyte, Tracy Wiles, Erin Yvette

Pre-order pages are also up early for the standard, Deluxe, and Collector’s Edition pages. Here’s what’s included in each:

The Marathon Standard Edition includes:

  • Access to all gameplay updates (maps, Runner shells, events, etc.) as the year progresses
  • Pre-order Marathon and also receive the following:
    • ZERO STEP 004 CE Tactical Sidearm Style
    • ZERO STEP RC Weapon Charm
    • ZERO STEP SHIFT Weapon Sticker
    • APOGEE INTERCEPT Background
    • APOGEE INTERCEPT Emblem
  • Plus the following pre-order rewards for Destiny 2 linked to your Bungie.net account:
    • UESC Echo-type Shell Exotic Ghost
    • UESC Rover Exotic Ship
    • UESC Sprinter Exotic Sparrow

The Marathon Deluxe Edition includes:

  • All Standard Edition content
  • 1x Premium Rewards Pass Voucher
  • 200 SILK Rewards Pass Tokens
  • Weapon Cosmetics:
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Misriah 2442 Pump Shotgun Style
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Overrun AR Style
  • Runner Shell Cosmetics:
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Vandal Shell Style
    • MIDNIGHT DECAY Destroyer Shell Style

item.title: Emergency Crews Briefly Seal Off GTA 6 Studio Following Boiler Explosion
item.content:encoded:
First responders, including six fire engines, descended upon Rockstar Games’ Edinburgh office, Rockstar North, early on Monday following reports of structural damage to the offices of the Grand Theft Auto 6 maker. The result of an apparent explosion of some kind, the incident thankfully left no one injured.

“We were alerted at 5:02 a.m. on Monday, 19 January to attend an incident on Holyrood Road, Edinburgh,” a spokesperson for emergency crews told The Herald. “Operations Control mobilized three fire appliances and specialist resources to the scene, where firefighters worked to secure structural damage at a commercial building. There were no reported casualties and crews left the scene at 9:21 a.m.”

According to Rockstar, the explosion was the result of a boiler malfunction and the studio remains fully operational as it prepares for the launch of GTA 6 in November.

“Early Monday morning, there was a malfunction in one of the heating boilers at Rockstar North,” a spokesperson for Rockstar Games told Kotaku in an email. “Many thanks to those that reached out with concern, and also to the police and fire crews who were on scene quickly to assess the situation–please know that everyone is well and our studio remains open and operational.”

The office has recently been at the center of an ongoing labor dispute with 31 fired developers who were trying to unionize. The workers claim they were targeted for trying to organize while Rockstar maintains they were fired for violations of confidentiality rules, including leaking development and gameplay details in a union Discord channel with outside observers.

A judge reviewing the case recently denied the fired GTA 6 devs immediate relief in the form of back pay, but a full ruling on the overall merits of the complaint is still pending.

item.title: Anker Clears Out Its MagSafe Charger Stand at Its Lowest Price, Charge Your iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods for Less
item.content:encoded:
The multi-functional, portable Anker MagSafe Charger Stand powers your iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods simultaneously in one location. This compact cube connects to an outlet via a single USB-C AC adapter connection and can be easily placed on any available desktop or nightstand. On top of the stand is a fold-down charger for an Apple Watch, and on the bottom of the unit is a designated area for wireless charging cases for AirPods. Plus, you can fold up the entire unit and take it with you if needed.

Go to Amazon to purchase the Anker 3-in-1 Multi-Device Wireless Charging Stand for just $97, saving $53 and reducing the price by approximately 35% from the original $150.

See at Amazon

Set it on your desktop, charge everything, and forget about it

The design of Anker’s 3-in-1 multi-device wireless charging stand allows you to place your iPhone in a horizontal position to view your screen, and place your Apple Watch on top of the unit and your wireless charging case for AirPods at the bottom, all in a relatively uncluttered manner. In addition, the iPhone portion of the unit is adjustable, allowing you to view your screen in both portrait and landscape orientations. Also, the stand is collapsible and can fit in a small drawer or travel pouch when collapsed.

As part of the Anker MagSafe wireless charging system, the unit supports MagSafe-compatible iPhone models with up to 15 watts of fast wireless charging. The internal magnets ensure the iPhone lines up correctly and that you don’t have to slide it around to find the optimal charging spot every time. The charging dock for your iPhone holds it steady in either portrait or landscape orientation, allowing you to view your screen while it charges.

Support for Apple Watches is extensive, covering most models. The raised platform for the watch allows the bands to hang naturally, and the back of the watch rests on the charging surface, eliminating the need to bend your watch straps into awkward positions. The base of the unit includes a pad specifically designed for wireless charging cases for AirPods, providing a specific charging location for your earbuds rather than forcing you to share the space with your iPhone.

A major advantage of this wireless charging stand’s travel-friendly design is that it can be used even when you don’t have access to multiple outlets. Closed, the unit appears to be a standard small black plastic box with a single USB-C port on the side so that it won’t snag on anything else in your backpack or carry-on. When opened next to a bed or on a small table, it eliminates the need for three separate charging stations while requiring only a single outlet.

Ready-to-go out-of-the-box accessories make using the Anker 3-in-1 MagSafe Wireless Charging Stand a breeze. Included with the unit are the 3-in-1 charging dock, a 30-watt USB-C wall adapter, and a five-foot-long USB-C to USB-C cable. For the low price of $97, reduced from the original $150, you’re receiving a compact charging dock that wirelessly charges your iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods with a single cable.

It also features protection against overcharging and automatically turns off when the device goes dormant, so you won’t waste electricity. Plus, it’s approved for flight travel by many airlines, so you don’t have to leave it behind on vacation.

You can purchase the INIU Ultra Slim 45W Portable Charger today from Amazon for $20. This is a savings of 17% off the usual $24 price tag.

Power in your palm, no matter where you travel

One of the things that makes the INIU Ultra Slim 45W Portable Charger so convenient is its lightweight, thin design. It is designed to be a very portable power source and is perfect for all types of travel, including weekend trips, business trips, and daily commutes. It meets the FAA requirements for travel on many domestic and international flights (check with the carrier for specific requirements), so you can take it in your carry-on luggage. The charger is made of a rubberized material that is comfortable to hold and resists scratches, making it easy to carry in your hand or attach to your belt via the built-in lanyard. The built-in USB-C cord serves double-duty as a quick-clip attachment to a purse, backpack strap, etc., allowing you to attach it to whatever accessory you choose, freeing up your hands.

In addition to charging a single mobile device, the INIU Ultra Slim 45W Portable Charger can charge two devices simultaneously via the Dual USB-C ports and a third device via the USB-A port, giving you the flexibility to charge your phone, headphones, and other accessories at the same time. The 45-Watt output allows you to quickly recharge many newer smartphones and small tablets. Because of this high output, even a brief charging session can result in a significant increase in the mobile device’s battery level. This charging capability means you can continue using your equipment for longer periods before needing to recharge it at an electrical outlet.

The built-in protections in this portable charger will protect it and your mobile device from damage caused by overcurrent, overvoltage, or excessive heat buildup, giving you peace of mind when you are charging with it. In addition to the protections mentioned above, simple LED indicator lights display the battery’s status, so you can tell whether it needs charging, and you’ll always know when your mobile devices are topped up.

All in all, the INIU Ultra Slim 45W Portable Charger was designed to provide users with reliable power to keep their mobile devices charged on the go without having to carry large, cumbersome batteries. At $20, it’s an affordable solution for anyone looking for fast, reliable portable power.
